title: Executive Order 5700-Permitting Public Health Service Officers to Serve in State, etc., Health Organizations, and Permitting Certain Appointments Under the Public Health Service
content: Executive Order No. 9 of January 17, 1873, is hereby amended so as to permit officers of the Public Health Service, upon recommendation of the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service and the approval of the Secretary of the Treasury, to hold office in State, Territorial, or local health organizations, in order to cooperate with and aid State, Territorial, or local health departments; and to permit State, Territorial, or local health officials or employees, unless prohibited by law, to hold office in the Public Health Service when the Surgeon General and the Secretary of the Treasury deem such employment necessary to secure a more efficient administration of the duties imposed upon the Public Health Service.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5700-Permitting Public Health Service Officers to Serve in State, etc., Health Organizations, and Permitting Certain Appointments Under the Public Health Service Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361280
